sentence.Network_en: Emotional conflict may shake the foundations of even the strongest relationship.
sentence.Network_cn: 情感冲突可以动摇哪怕是最牢固的人际关系的基础。

sentence.Network_en: If the foundations are flawed the house will come tumbling down.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果地基不牢，房子将会倒塌。

sentence.Network_en: The builders are now beginning to lay the foundations of the new school.
sentence.Network_cn: 建筑工人正开始给新校舍打地基。

entry.def: The foundation of something such as a belief or way of life is the things on which it is based.

example.ex: Best friends are the foundation of my life...
example.tran: 好朋友是我生命的支柱。

example.ex: The issue strikes at the very foundation of our community...
example.tran: 这个问题严重影响了我们社会的基本根基。

entry.def: The foundations of a building or other structure are the layer of bricks or concrete below the ground that it is built on.
A foundation is an organization which provides money for a special purpose such as research or charity.
If a story, idea, or argument has no foundation, there are no facts to prove that it is true.

example.ex: Each complaint is analysed very closely, and if it has no foundation it is rejected.
example.tran: 每个投诉都经过仔细分析，如果发现没有依据就会予以驳回。

entry.def: Foundation is a skin-coloured cream that you put on your face before putting on the rest of your make-up.

auth_sentence.content: Sweden then boasted two universities, both ancient foundations.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Sweden then boasted two universities, both ancient foundations.

auth_sentence.content: It was never rebuilt and only the foundations remain.

auth_sentence.content: But fissures are showing in China's economic foundations.
auth_sentence.res_content: But fissures are showing in China's economic foundations.

Sentence.sentence: Later working together in London, they laid the foundations of modern physics by showing that normal laws of cause and effect do not apply at the level of subatomic particles.
Laying the foundations of modem mathematics
We first see ourselves through the eyes of others, so their messages form important foundations of our self-concepts.
